question: The NAACP was formed on February 12, 1909 largely in part due to the 1908 race riots in Springfield, Illinois. This date was chosen because it was the centennial anniversary of the birth of Abraham Lincoln.
Jack Johnson was the first African American man to hold the World's Heavyweight Boxing Champion title in the year 1908. Jack held onto the belt until 1915.

In 1968, Shirley Chrisholm was the first African American woman elected to the House of Representatives. She was elected to represent the state of New York, and four years later she was the first major party African American candidate, and the first female candidate for president of the United States.
